required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Population Pharmacokinetics and Dosage Individualization of Paracetamol and Ibuprofen in Children With PDA
clinical_study.official_title: Population Pharmacokinetics and Dosage Individualization of Paracetamol and Ibuprofen in Preterm Neonates and Infants With Patent Ductus Arteriosus

brief_summary.textblock: The investigator's purpose is to study the population pharmacokinetics of paracatamol and ibuprofen in neonates with patent ductus arteriosus (PDA) and assess the feasibility of dosage individualization.

detailed_description.textblock: The investigator's purpose is to study the population pharmacokinetics of paracatamol and ibuprofen in neonates with patent ductus arteriosus (PDA) and assess the feasibility of dosage individualization. In this study, the investigator will detect drug concentration in plasma and other clinical test to construct population pharmacokinetic models.

primary_outcome.time_frame: at (0-1) hour, (1-3) hours, (3-5) hours, (5-6) hours after oral administration
primary_outcome.description: To detect the plasma concentration of paracetamol after administration

primary_outcome.time_frame: at (0-1.5) hours, (1-4) hours, (4-12) hours,(12-24) hours after oral administration
primary_outcome.description: To detect the plasma concentration of ibuprofen after administration

primary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, an average of 3 days
primary_outcome.description: To measure arterial duct diameter, shunt speed and direction of shunt

primary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, an average of 3 days
primary_outcome.description: To detect brain natriuretic peptide(BNP) and troponin T(cTnT)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, an average of 3 days
secondary_outcome.description: Drug-related adverse events and serious adverse events

arm_group.description: Paracetamol and ibuprofen are administered at standard dose for children with PDA.

intervention.description: 10 mg/kg qd for the 1st day, 5 mg/kg qd for the 2nd and 3rd day

responsible_party.investigator_title: Professor; Head of department of clinical pharmacy and pharmacology
